  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING CORNED BEEF. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN ELEVEN OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE MG CHEMICALS 4223F PREMIUM POLYURETHANE CONFORMAL COATING. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MICHIGAN USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 978R80, MARKSETBOT, 2200 HUNT ST, DETROIT MI 48207-5605.

  • Description: Driver was blowing out his line on the sulfuric acid tank and the loading line on the tank broke. This sent 10-15 gallons of material into containment. Customer was notified and put down soda ash in containment. No injuries or exposure

item.title: Report I-2025030009
item.description:
Report I-2025030009

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: DETROIT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A pipe broke on the customer tank while filling and there was a release of 50-100 gallons of sulfuric acid onto the ground, storm sewer and gravel. This was a RQ and NRC was contacted. Customer accepted responsibility and a clean up crew was called to remediate the spill. No Injuries/Exposures.

item.title: Report E-2025030072
item.description:
Report E-2025030072

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to site. Personnel observed approximately 50 gallons of product released impacting an 8' x 15' area underneath the trailer and an 8' x 25' area of the trailer floor. Personnel advised they unloaded the trailer and used absorbents to contain the spill, additionally they used sodium bicarbonate solution to neutralize impacted areas along with simple green to clean. Hepaco advised they completed the tote transfer and that roughly 200 gallons were transferred into the new poly tote. The impacted tote was cut up and the bulk of the impacted solids was removed from the trailer. Hepaco personnel confirmed the trailer floor has been cleaned and neutralized, pH read came back balanced. They generated eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums containing spent absorbents, PPE, impacted pallets, poly sheeting and cut up tote. ESTES approved of the work completed.
